buttons.CreateAngleToolUseMessage: Select two lines/segments or three points to calculate an angle.
buttons.CreateAntipodalPointToolUseMessage: Select a location to create a point (if necessary) and its antipode
buttons.CreatePolarToolTipMessage: Create polar line or polar points
buttons.CreatePolarToolUseMessage: Select a location to create a point (if necessary) and its polar line or select a line segment or line to create both polar points
buttons.CreateCircleToolUseMessage: Click to insert a circle with a given center point and through a second point.
buttons.CreateCoordinateToolUseMessage: Select a point to measure its x,y,z coordinates on the sphere
buttons.CreateEllipseToolUseMessage: Select two distinct non-antipodal points and another point on the ellipse
buttons.CreateIntersectionToolUseMessage: Select two one-dimensional objects to create their intersection point(s).
buttons.CreateLineSegmentToolUseMessage: Click to insert line segment defined by two points.
buttons.CreateLineToolUseMessage: Click to insert a line defined by two points.
buttons.CreatePointDistanceToolUseMessage: Select two points to measure the distance between them
buttons.CreatePointOnOneDimToolTipMessage: Select a one-dimensional object to place a point on
buttons.CreatePointOnOneDimToolUseMessage: Select a one-dimensional object to add a point to.
buttons.CreatePointToolUseMessage: Click to insert a free point.
buttons.CreateSegmentLengthToolUseMessage: Click this button to compute the length of Line Segment
buttons.CreateSliderToolUseMessage: Click this button to create a value slider
buttons.CreatePerpendicularToolUseMessage: Create a perpendicular line to a selected one-dimensional object and selected location.
buttons.DeleteToolUseMessage: Select objects to delete. Hold the SHIFT key to select from the back of the sphere.
buttons.HideObjectToolUseMessage: Select objects to hide. Hold the SHIFT key to select from the back of the sphere.
buttons.MoveObjectToolUseMessage: Click and drag an object to move it. Movable objects include labels, free points, and line segments with antipodal endpoints. Hold the SHIFT key to select from the back of the sphere.
buttons.PanZoomInToolUseMessage: Click to zoom in at the location of the mouse. Click and drag to pan the current view.
buttons.PanZoomOutToolUseMessage: Click to zoom out at the location of the mouse. Click and drag to pan the current view.
buttons.ZoomFitToolUseMessage: Fits the sphere in the available space.
buttons.RotateSphereToolUseMessage: Click and drag to rotate the sphere.
buttons.SelectToolUseMessage: Click on objects to select them, hold the Alt key to add to your selection.
buttons.ToggleLabelToolUseMessage: Click on objects to toggle the display of their labels.
buttons.CreateIconToolUseMessage: Click to create an the SVG paths for an icon from current view.

objects.segments: Line Segments | Line Segment | line segment

style.label: 1 Label | {count} Labels
style.noFillLabelTip: If you want to make the labels only appear on the front of the sphere disable automatic back styling and check 'No Fill' on the Label Back Fill Color. Similarly, to make the labels only appear on the back of the sphere disable automatic back styling and check 'No Fill' on the Label Front Fill Color.
style.closeOrSelect: Close the styling panel or select object(s).
style.selectionDirection1: Click on glowing objects to select them.
style.selectionDirection2: Hold the Alt/Option key to add or subtract from your selection.
style.selectionDirection3: Press a number key to select an object at that depth.
style.selectionDirection4: Press the p key and click in any empty location to add all points. Similar for lines (l), line segments (s), circles (c), ellipses (e), and angle markers (a).
style.noSelectionToolTip: No objects are currently selected. Either select objects with the selection tool or click this button to close the style panel.
style.clickToMakeLabelsVisible: Click the button below to make all labels visible and then to style them.
style.labelsNotShowingToolTip: Not all labels in the current selection are visible. Click this button to make them visible and then they will be styleable.
style.clickToMakeObjectsVisible: Click the button below to make all objects visible and then to style them.
style.objectsNotShowingToolTip: Not all objects in the current selection are visible. Click this button to make them visible and then they will be styleable.
style.differentValues: The selected objects have different values for at least one of these style options. Click the button and edit a style to make all selected objects have that style value in common.
style.differentValuesToolTip: The selected objects have different values for at least one style option. Click the button and edit a style to make all selected objects have that style value in common.
style.disableDynamicBackStyleToolTip: The styling of objects on the back of the sphere is handled automatically unless disabled. The automatic style depends on a Back Styling Contrast percent and the front styling. The contrast is a global variable and applies to all objects the have Dynamic Back Styling enabled. If the contrast is 100%, then there is no difference between the styling of objects on the front and the back of the sphere. If the contrast is 0%, then colors on back of sphere are almost transparent and size reduction is maximized for points and thicknesses. Dash pattern is not effected by the contrast. The Back Contrast percent may be set in the Background Style panel.
style.clearChangesToolTip: Revert the selected object(s) back to the style they had when they were *first* selected.
style.restoreDefaultsToolTip: Revert the selected object(s) back to their default(s).
style.showColorInputsToolTip: Click this to enter color code values directly.
style.disableBackStyleContrastSlider: Click To Disable Dynamic Back Style For Selected Object(s)
style.disableBackStyleContrastSliderToolTip: The selected objects have dynamic back style enabled. Click this button disable it for only the selected object(s). Then you can change the back style of the selected object(s) using the style options in this panel.
style.disableDashPatternSliderToolTip: Click this button to set no dash pattern on all selected object(s).
style.enableBackStyleContrastSlider: Click To Enable Dynamic Back Style For Selected Object(s)
style.enableBackStyleContrastSliderToolTip: The selected objects do not have dynamic back style enabled. Click this button enable it and adjust the Back Contrast Slider.
style.convertSelectionToLabels: A mix of label and non-label objects were selected when all label displays were changed. In order to do this the current selection was converted to all the labels of those objects.
style.dashPatternCheckBoxToolTip: Enable or Disable a dash pattern for the selected objects.
style.backStyleContrastToolTip: By default the back side display style of an object is determined by the front style of that object and the value of Back Style Contrast. A Back Style Contrast of 100% means there is no color or size difference between front and back styling. A Back Style Contrast of 0% means that the object is barely visible and its size reduction is maximized.
style.maxMinLabelDisplayTextLengthWarning: Must be between 1 and {max} characters long.
style.maxMinLabelDisplayCaptionLengthWarning: Must be at most {max} characters long.

handlers.ellipseAntipodalSelected: The foci of an ellipse are not allowed to be antipodal or identical. Select another location.
handlers.ellipseFocus2Selected: All foci of the ellipse selected. Now select a point on the ellipse.
handlers.ellipseFocus1Selected: One focus of the ellipse selected. Now select a second non-antipodal focus.
handlers.ellipseInitiallyToSmall: To create an ellipse initially you must select a point on the ellipse that is further away from each focus. Select a different location further from the foci.
handlers.circleCenterSelected: Center of circle selected. Now select a point on the circle.
handlers.segmentsWithOutCommonEndpoint: The selected segment does not have a common endpoint with the previously selected one. Select another.
handlers.segmentWithOutEndpointOnLine: The selected segment does not have a endpoint on the previously selected line. Select another.
handlers.lineDoesNotContainEndpointOfSegment: The selected line does contain an endpoint on the previously selected segment. Select another.
handlers.antipodalPointMessage: The selected point is antipodal or equal to the first selected point. Select another.
handlers.antipodalPointMessage2: The selected point is antipodal or equal to the second selected point. Select another.
handlers.intersectionOneDimensionalSelected: One dimensional object {name} selected. Select another.
handlers.moveHandlerObjectOnBackOfSphere: Were you trying to move an object on the back of the sphere?  If so, press and hold the shift key to select objects on the back of the sphere.
handlers.selectionUpdate: Selection Update: {number} objects selected. Hold the Alt/Option key to add or subtract from the current selection.
handlers.pointCreationAttemptDuplicate: There is already a point at this location.
handlers.perpendicularLineThruPointPointSelected: Point selected. Now select a one dimensional object to determine the perpendicular.
handlers.perpendicularLineThruPointLineSelected: Line {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.perpendicularLineThruPointSegmentSelecte: Segment {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.perpendicularLineThruPointCircleSelected: Circle {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.perpendicularLineThruPointEllipseSelecte: Ellipse {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.perpendicularLineThruPointParametricSele: Parametric {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.antipodeDuplicate: The antipode of this point has already been created.
handlers.polarLineDuplicate: The polar line of this point has already been created.
handlers.polarPointDuplicate: The polar points of this {object} has already been created.

objectTree.parserError: Reached end of input while parsing expression
objectTree.cycleValueDisplayMode: Click to cycle to the next value display mode including multiples of pi and degrees.
objectTree.toggleDisplay: Toggle the display of the corresponding object.
objectTree.xCoordExpressionTip: An expression (depending on measurement tokens) for the x coordinate for the parametric curve.
objectTree.xCoordPrimeExpressionTip: The derivative of the x coordinate formula for the parametric curve.
objectTree.yCoordExpressionTip: An expression (depending on measurement tokens) for the y coordinate for the parametric curve.
objectTree.yCoordPrimeExpressionTip: The derivative of the y coordinate formula for the parametric curve.
objectTree.zCoordExpressionTip: An expression (depending on measurement tokens) for the z coordinate for the parametric curve.
objectTree.zCoordPrimeExpressionTip: The derivative of the z coordinate formula for the parametric curve.
objectTree.tMinExpressionTip: An optional expression (depending on measurements tokens) that gives the starting t value when tracing the parametric curve. This value is always evaluated to be greater than or equal to the minimum parameter value.
objectTree.tMaxExpressionTip: An optional expression (depending on measurements tokens) that gives the ending t value when tracing the parametric curve. This value is always evaluated to be less than or equal to the maximum parameter value.
objectTree.exactlyOneEmptyTExpression: Maximum and Minimum Parameter Tracing Expression must either both be empty or both be defined.
objectTree.tMinNumberTip: A required absolute minimum t value for tracing the parametric curve that is the lower bound for the optional tMin Tracing Expression.
objectTree.tMaxNumberTip: A required absolute minimum t value for tracing the parametric curve that is the upper bound for the optional tMax Tracing Expression.
objectTree.tMinNotLessThantMax: The minimum t value must be less than the maximum t value for at least one set of measurements. Change at least one t value expressions.
objectTree.notAUnitParametricCurve: Parametric curves must on the unit sphere; this curve was not unit at a t value of {tVal}. Check the coordinates of the parametric formulas.
objectTree.notPerpCurveAndDerivative: The parametric derivative must be perpendicular to the the unit parametric curve vector; these were not perpendicular at a t value of {tVal}.
objectTree.anglePoints: Angle formed by points {p1}, {p2}, and {p3}. Value: {val}
objectTree.angleSegments: Angle formed by lines {line1} and {line2}. Value: {val}
objectTree.angleLines: Angle formed by segments {seg1} and {seg2}. Value: {val}
objectTree.angleSegmentLine: Angle formed by segment {seg} and line {line}. Value: {val}
objectTree.angleLineSegment: Angle formed by line {line} and segment {seg}. Value: {val}
objectTree.aPolarPointOf: Polar point of line {line} with index {index}.
objectTree.ellipseThrough: Ellipse with foci {focus1} and {focus2} through point {through}
objectTree.lineThrough: Line through points {pt1} and {pt2} with normal vector <{normalX},{normalY},{normalZ}>
objectTree.polarLine: Polar line to point {pt} with normal vector <{normalX},{normalY},{normalZ}>
objectTree.segmentThrough: Line segment with endpoints {pt1} and {pt2} and normal vector <{normalX},{normalY},{normalZ}>
objectTree.perpendicularLineThru: Perpendicular line to {oneDimensionalParentType} {oneDimensional} through point {pt} with index {index}
objectTree.parametricDescription: Parametric curve with coordinates ({xExpression}, {yExpression}, {zExpression}) for t from {tMinNumber} to {tMaxNumber}.
objectTree.duplicateParametricCurve: Duplicate parametric curves are not allowed.

constructions.unsavedConstructionMsg: You have unsaved work. Do you want to stay on this page and keep your work or switch to another page and discard your work.
constructions.unsavedObjectsMsg: You have unsaved objects. Loading a new construction will remove all the current ones. Do you want to proceed or cancel?
